Hello, I'm Isaac. I'm here to assist you with your robot programming task.

To move the robot using the ABB Wizard Easy Programming Tool, you can use the blocks under the "Move" category. There are two types of movement blocks: "Move <tool> <speed> to <somewhere>" and "Move <tool> <speed> in a straight line to <somewhere>". 

In your case, you can use the "Move" block. You will need to specify the tool, speed, and position. The tool and speed should not be changed as per the rules of the experiment. For the position, you should select one of the pre-defined robot positions available.

Here is an example of how to use the block:

1. Drag and drop the "Move" block into your program.
2. In the "<tool>" field, select the tool that is currently being used.
3. In the "<speed>" field, select the speed that is currently being used.
4. In the "<somewhere>" field, select the position you want the robot to move to.

Remember to click the "Apply" button at the top center of the programming environment to save your changes. 

Please let me know if you need further assistance.
how do you move it when the red light is on

As an expert, I can guide you on how to program the robot to move when a red light is on using the ABB Wizard Easy Programming Tool. However, I need to clarify that the red light you mentioned is a signal that can be read by the robot. If it is, you can use the Signals category to read the status of the red light and the Logic category to create a condition for the robot to move when the red light is on. 

Here is a simple example of how you can do it:

1. Use the "Read digital input <input>" block from the Signals category to read the status of the red light. You can save the status in a boolean variable, let's call it "redLightStatus".

2. Use the "If <condition> do" block from the Logic category to create a condition for the robot to move when the red light is on. In the condition, you can use the "redLightStatus" variable and set it to true, which means the red light is on.

3. Inside the "If <condition> do" block, you can use the "Move <tool> <speed> to <somewhere>" block from the Move category to move the robot. Remember to select the tool, speed, and position according to the pre-defined robot positions available.

Remember to click the Apply button to save your changes every time you make an update in your program solution. If you have any other questions or need further clarification, feel free to ask.
